title.label: The best game I've ever played

content.label: I'm a advanced gamer and can not believe I just found this game. It is amazing. It's got perfect classic artwork, beautiful music and an amazing story
Not a role-playing game or a Civilization clone, but a storytelling game.

For the longest time I wanted to play this game, but the price tag was keeping me from buying it. Finally over my Christmas break I bit the bullet and picked it up.

The first play through or so, I had a lot of fun, the problem is, there really isn't that much to do, and often times you'll find yourself doing the same things over and over and over.

Also, while the game feels kind of free form, it's not really a sandbox style game, at some point you'll find yourself being pressured to become a clan, people will start to leave and at some point, unless you become a clan, you'll hit a glass wall.

In the end I can't really call it a simulation game because it's far too much based on luck and "magic".

After about 4 or 5 play throughs I got sick of the game and dropped it. Not really worth the price tag.
Way too expensive for what you get. This app is worth 2 dollars.

title.label: Interesting game, but has some flaws.

content.label: I love the concept of this game. The art is beautiful and it makes the game a lot more enjoyable. But this game has some flaws. I hate how the decisions you make have seemly random consequences. Also, raiding results seems very random. It feels like there is not much you can do other than accept some random consequences of your actions. Also, some events repeat themselves consecutively. For example, some old lady is found doing evil magic, I resolve this event, only to have the same event show up again a few minutes later. Also, hero quests are very boring and suffer from the same random consequences. But this time you end up losing one of your best clan member for seemly no reason.
Fun game.

I've been playing this game for years and the wonderful development staff keeps making updates. They released this on iOS in 2010  and are still releasing new content! It may take awhile to master the game, but it's certainly worth it. Even disastrous playthroughs where you get destroyed by beast men or dragons are fun. I highly recommend this game for dedicated roleplaying and strategy gamers.
There's no logic in this game and it's impossible to finish a hero quest.  I can't believe I spent $10 on it.

Great concept, just WAY WAY WAY too many rules.  It makes the sim VERY difficult to analyze. Results often seem arbitrary.  I think with more time invested I could figure it out but I'm just not willing to put that kind of effort in.
I've been playing this more then I play games on my laptop or ps4 it's awesome
What a awesome game I wish that I could live in it

title.label: One of the best games EVER

content.label:
I have enjoyed this game so many times, over and over. It pulls you into the world of Dragon Pass, and you will not want to leave. Stunning illustrations and complex stories with follow-up events help to build a thrilling plot, and the game never stops being challenging! 

Best purchase I ever made in the Apple Store.
One of the best games ever!

Absolutely enthralling game. And the UI is phenomenal. I've never seen an old computer game better ported to an iPhone. Hours and hours of fun, and so much replay value! A must have for fantasy RPG/strategy gamers.

I've been playing this game for many years, and I love the updates that are released periodically. It is an investment up front and worth every penny. The gameplay provides a wide variety of situations, characters, and gods, as well as a fully fleshed out history of the land. I like to play this game over and over. Think "Choose Your Own Adventure" with dinosaurs, raiders, and magic. It's worth your time.

This is truly a great app, and great game. Well worth the 10 bucks I dropped on it. I've bought 60 dollar games that give me as much game time as this 10 dollar app. With a interesting story (IMO) hours of gameplay for a single campaign, and excellent replay value, this game has entertained me for many hours. The ONLY quarrel I have personally have with this game, is that it doesn't have multiple save slots for separate campaigns. Which is fine considering the type of game this is, however if at all possible (idk as I'm not a game developer) I would love to see this simple (I think?) feature added in a future update. Thanks for the great game.

This deep, text-driven game engulfs you in a richly described world. In some ways it is the Platonic ideal of Choose Your Own Adventure, because you continually make choices that drive the narrative. However, there are random events, a rhythm driven by the seasons of the year, a complete fantasy culture. In other ways, it resembles FTL in that you have a long-term goal and no take-backs (in the overused inaccurate vernacular, it is "rogue-like"). It costs the same as a movie -- think of it as a deeper experience, even though it lacks the flash of special effects and animation. More novel than most novels, and worth the price.

I downloaded this game for a 12 hour flight. I played it for 6 hours without looking up from my phone. I never played it on PC, but the iOS version is by far the best app on my phone, and it's one of my all time favorites on any platform. Completely worth 10 dollars.
I've played many games on my iphone and this one is hands down my favorite that I go back to time and again. Definitely worth picking up.

I absolutely love this game! From the wars to the sometimes backstabbing politics of a tribe it is a great game. The only thing I would want added would be the ability to sell my captured thralls. Either way I would recommend this to anyone.

I find many ios games by and large disappointing. Kodp is the rare exception. It is one of the few games on the platform which has the depth required to keep a hardened turn-based strategy gamer like me engaged. I also love the music and artwork. I have been gaming since the 80s so I've played a few games in my time.

title.label: Don't waste your money on this game

content.label:
I played this game thoroughly for a few weeks and beat it a few times so it's not like I didn't give it a chance or didn't learn how to play. I was looking for a 4x type game and after reading all the great reviews this game has here and on meta critic I dropped the ten bucks on it. If you're thinking of getting this game let me tell you, these people boasting over it are total fanboys, this game is worth 1 maybe 2 dollars max, 10 is a crime. This company should be ashamed of themselves for charging this price.

It appears very intricate and it is hard and addictive at first but once you figure it out you discover that the gameplay is very predetermined. If you want to not die then you are forced into using the same playstyle everytime. The scenarios and storylines are plentiful but after one playthrough they become very repetitive, there is very little replay value unless you are super into learning the all the lore in the game.

There is a lot of nice artwork and very in depth lore. If you're really into that then maybe this is the game for you. If you're looking for an actual strategy game then look elsewhere, there are great games out there that blow KoDP out of the water and cost half the price.

By the way I've never written a review for anything before, but I had to post this because it's just wrong how all these people are misleading everyone by 5 starring this.

Ok. So I don't really write many reviews, but this exceptional game is an exception. I devoured this game ever since I first downloaded it around Christmas time. It never, ever gets old. Please get it everyone. The time and money will most definitely be worth your while. Every single aspect of it was captivating and intriguing. From the beautiful illustrations to the nail biting quests and battles, you can't go wrong. So please. Go ahead and spend a little ten bucks on this amazing game. Join us in the conquest for Dragonpass!

This game is worth every cent and then some. I've tried out the PC version as well, but the iOS version is definitive! I picked it up ok a whim but quickly got sucked into the world of KODP and found Glorantha so interesting.

title.label: Best Game I Have Ever Played!

content.label: This game is extremely unique and fun, it may be a little pricey but it is well worth it. This game is very unpredictable, every choice you makes effects your people and the people of dragon pass, this is an extremely fun and addicting game, I recommend this to anyone and everyone!
Play to relax and enjoy your time off reality.
I've enjoyed it a lot. Not even my favorite game on my phone but I really respect the originality. Entertaining.
Deep, complex, yet simple to play and understand. Very fun classic PC game ported well to iPad.

This game has such amazing depth and wonderful stories, all of which seem to have endless possible outcomes, This is probably the best strategy game on iPad. I absolutely love it.  This is first time I've ever decided to actually review a game in the App Store after, you know why?, because this game is worth it.
Seriously, you're doing yourself wrong if you don't play this one through. Difficult, unique, quirky, and all around fun.

This can be brutally difficult, frustrating, and confusing.  It is also a nearly flawless rpg masterpiece with real far-reaching consequences for actions.  For the first week I didn't even know that you could restart days, and I STILL thought it was a great game.  Buy it.
This is my favorite iOS game. Deeply engaging and continually challenging.

I'm a huge fan of this game since having it on PC so long ago. I recommend buying it for sure. If your playing games for a fun, yet thoughtful challenge, then this is the game for you. It's really great to see a game that isn't just mindless drivel and explosions or gun work. This game is a refreshing change nowadays. AND it's always fun to come back to after a hiatus. The only negative I can think of is that there aren't more of these games.. Playing as trolls or beast men or dragonnewts or any of the other fantastic species would be a blast! Edit: just started again. Can't believe I've been playing this for years and only beat it once :)
Edit2: delighted to see new scenes coming to this game. The few negative reviews seem to be people that have trouble understanding written language, or not caring at all to get into the lore. (Everything you need for hero quests is readily available, part of the game is learning them, whether it's from sacrifices/blessings or other tribes).

This is a rich text-based interactive game.  It has many role playing elements.  Also it has a lot of replay value.  The story can be a bit silly at times, but it is also very serious.  The story has a very unique Norse-like lore.
Simply put, slightly hard at first, but enjoyable deep without being silly in amount of details.
By far the best App on my iPhone right now. I just wish I hadn't bought it on vacation... I'm spending more time playing this than being in the pool.

This game is unique and fascinating. You may find it hard at first, but rest assured, you will get better. Don't expect to find the one best answer to any problem; leader skills, luck, and other factors matter greatly. Be brave and honest, hope for the best, and keep trying.

I've been playing KoDP for over ten years and I'm still finding new things.
best iphone game i have and the developer keeps updating with new content.
Best game ever

KoDP is highly story focused, with randomly timed events which have consequences years down the line. It is far less a civilization-style management simulation and far more a politicking and plotting story game.
This game.  Just goddamn. Get this game. Kickin music and so much to discover!  Lots of content and not too draining on the battery.
Classic fantasy storytelling. No flashy animations needed. Just superb art and words.

KoDP is a really great game. Loads of content keep you coming back to try and manage the ultimate clan. Very akin to a more interactive Choose Your Own Adventure with exploration and town building/management elements. The app itself is top notch and plays great on iPhone or iPad. Definitely give KoDP a try.

Just complex enough.  Great storyline. Interactions with other tribes and clans is superb. Your choices now will have consequences years later.  Excellent replay-ability.  I return to this app time and again, and am never disappointed.
I love this game
This is a tremendously fun game of you like intelligent strategy within a complex mythology/universe
I've never played a game like this. The gameplay and style are unlike anything else. Thoroughly original, like a giant choose your own adventure mixed with the art of Magic the Gathering.
Brilliant translation from PC to iOS. This version is actually improved greatly from the original. Interface is fantastic. Gameplay is timeless.

Also, thanks for the update I started playing it again just now. What a strange coincidence. Replay value, story depth, gameplay and sound can really get you into it. Worth the price I paid for it years ago.

KODP is the greatest ipad rpg experience to date. The events are clever, almost impossible to predict, and playing without totally understanding the inner workings really gives the game a flavor of exploration and discovery few have achieved.
